intro: Nitrosalsola gaetula, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in hot, dry climates with minimal water requirements. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming during the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration. Nitrosalsola gaetula is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
